citation.article-title: Actinomycetospora chiangmaiensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Pseudonocardiaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Actinomycetospora (Ac.ti′no.my.ce.to.spo′ra. N.Gr. n. actinomyces -etos an actinomycete; Gr. fem. n. spora a seed and, in bacteriology, a spore; N.L. fem. n. Actinomycetospora referring to an actinomycete with spore chains).
Substrate mycelium fragments into rod-shaped elements.
No aerial mycelium is produced on any medium tested.
The cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Whole-cell hydrolysates contain arabinose and galactose (cell-wall chemotype IV).
Phosphatidylcholine is the diagnostic phospholipid, with phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylglycerol.
The type species is Actinomycetospora chiangmaiensis.
